articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pledged Tuesday to launch an incursion into the southern Gaza city of Rafah, where hundreds of thousands of Palestinians are sheltering from the almost 7-month-long war, as cease-fire negotiations between Israel and Hamas appear to be gaining steam.
articles.title: Netanyahu vows to invade Rafah 'with or without a deal' as cease-fire talks with Hamas continue

articles.author: MIKE CORDER
articles.description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — Israeli officials sound increasingly concerned that the International Criminal Court could issue arrest warrants for the country’s leaders more than six months into the Israel-Hamas war.
articles.title: What is the International Criminal Court and why it has Israeli officials worried

articles.author: JIM VERTUNO, CEDAR ATTANASIO, JAKE OFFENHARTZ and JONATHAN MATTISE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Dozens of protesters took over a building at Columbia University in New York early Tuesday, barricading the entrances and unfurling a Palestinian flag out of a window in the latest escalation of demonstrations against the Israel-Hamas war that have spread to college campuses nationwide.
articles.title: Protesters take over Columbia University's Hamilton Hall in escalation of anti-war demonstrations

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK, JENNIFER PELTZ, JAKE OFFENHARTZ and COLLEEN LONG
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The first week of testimony at Donald Trump's hush money trial was the scene-setter for jurors: Manhattan prosecutors portrayed what they say was an illegal scheme to influence the 2016 presidential campaign by burying negative stories.
articles.title: Prosecutors at Donald Trump's hush money trial zero in on the details

articles.author: ERIK VERDUZCO and PETER SMITH
articles.description: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — Four law officers serving a warrant for a felon wanted for possessing a firearm were killed and four other officers were wounded in a shootout Monday at a North Carolina home, police said.
articles.title: 4 law officers serving warrant are killed, 4 wounded in shootout at North Carolina home, police say

articles.author: STEPHANY MATAT
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — Jordan Vassallo is lukewarm about casting her first presidential ballot for President Joe Biden in November. But when the 18-year-old senior at Jupiter High School in Florida thinks about the things she cares about, she says her vote for the Democratic incumbent is an “obvious choice.”
articles.title: Florida Democrats hope abortion and marijuana questions draw young voters despite low enthusiasm

articles.author: MARK STEVENSON
articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — A retired Roman Catholic bishop who was famous for trying to mediate between drug cartels in Mexico was located and taken to a hospital after apparently being briefly kidnapped, the Mexican Council of Bishops said Monday.
articles.title: Abducted retired Catholic bishop who mediated between cartels in Mexico is located, hospitalized

articles.author: RIAZAT BUTT
articles.description: KABUL, Afghanistan (AP) — Around 30 men are crammed into a Kabul classroom, part of the debut student cohort at a Taliban-run institute training tourism and hospitality professionals. It’s a motley crew.
articles.title: The Taliban are working to woo tourists to Afghanistan

articles.author: DAKE KANG
articles.description: SHANGHAI (AP) — The first scientist to publish a sequence of the COVID-19 virus in China staged a sit-in protest outside his lab after authorities locked him out of the facility — a sign of the Beijing's continuing pressure on scientists conducting research on the coronavirus.
articles.title: Chinese scientist who first published COVID sequence stages protest after being locked out of lab

articles.author: PAT GRAHAM
articles.description: DENVER (AP) — The futures of LeBron James and Darvin Ham with the Los Angeles Lakers are murky after their first-round playoff exit. One might choose to leave and the other might not have a choice.
articles.title: James, Ham face uncertain futures with Lakers after being eliminated from playoffs by Nuggets again
